taxonomicnotes: Mystus leucophasis was described from the Sittang and other rivers in Myanmar (Blyth 1860).
rationale: Despite being targeted in artisanal fisheries and being sometimes harvested as an ornamental fish, the level of exploitation is not deemed high enough to be a threat to long-term survival of this species. This is especially since the main source of the fish for the ornamental fish trade is now captive-bred. Therefore, Mystus leucophasis is assessed as Least Concern here.
evaluator: Pal, M., Vishwanath, W. & Molur, S.
